titleStmt.title: The spirit of popery speaking out of the mouths of phanatical-Protestants, or, The last speeches of Mr. John Kid and Mr. John King, two Presbyterian ministers, who were executed for high-treason and rebellion at Edinburgh, August the 14th, 1679 with animadversions, and the history of the Archbishop of St. Andrews his murder, extracted out of the registers of the Privy-Council, &c. / by an orthodox Protestant.
titleStmt.author: Hickes, George, 1642-1715.

titleStmt.title: The spirit of popery speaking out of the mouths of phanatical-Protestants, or, The last speeches of Mr. John Kid and Mr. John King, two Presbyterian ministers, who were executed for high-treason and rebellion at Edinburgh, August the 14th, 1679 with animadversions, and the history of the Archbishop of St. Andrews his murder, extracted out of the registers of the Privy-Council, &c. / by an orthodox Protestant.
titleStmt.author: Hickes, George, 1642-1715.
Kid, John, d. 1679.
King, John, d. 1679.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by H. Hills and are to be sold by Walter Kittleby ...,

notesStmt.note: Written by George Hickes. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.).
"A true and short narrative of the horrid murder of the Reverend Father in God, James, Archbishop of St. Andrews" has special t.p.
Errata: p. [12] at beginning and p. [6] at end.
Reproduction of original in Library of Congress.
